sentences.en: After the elections opposition groups began to emerge.
sentences.cn: 经过选举，反对派开始露头。

sentences.en: Consequently, even as the blogosphere continues to expand, only a few blogs are likely to emerge as focal points.
sentences.cn: 结果，尽管博客圈继续扩大，但仅有少数的博客有可能脱颖而出，成为关注的焦点。

sentences.en: He waited for her to emerge on the near side.
His voice stopped short as he saw the blade emerge from Desmond's pocket.
sentences.cn: 当他看到从德斯蒙德口袋里露出的刀刃时，他突然不吭声了。

sentences.en: It's still hard to tell who will emerge victorious.
Local police chiefs should re-emerge as figures of authority and reassurance in their areas.
sentences.cn: 地方警察局局长应该重新成为其所治一方具有权威和安定人心的人物。

sentences.en: No one could emerge from that avalanche alive, unless one believed that man could rise from the dead.
sentences.cn: 没人能从那次雪崩中活着出来, 除非相信人能死而复生.

sentences.en: The baby's head was starting to emerge from the womb.
sentences.cn: 婴儿的头开始从母亲的子宮中露出来.

sentences.en: The cancer may re-emerge years later.
sentences.cn: 癌症可能在多年之后复发。

sentences.en: The chilling facts behind this veil of silence were slow to emerge.
sentences.cn: 沉默背后的骇人真相慢慢显露出来。

sentences.en: The favoured candidate will probably emerge after private discussions.
sentences.cn: 中意的候选人很可能将在私下讨论后产生。

sentences.en: The flowers emerge in the spring.
The missiles emerge from the underbelly of the transport plane.
sentences.cn: 导弹从那架运输机的底部飞了出来。

sentences.en: The movement is developing , new things have yet to emerge, and they are emerging in an endless stream.
sentences.cn: 运动在发展中,又有新的东西在前头, 新东西是层出不穷的.

sentences.en: The pupae remain dormant in the soil until they emerge as adult moths in the winter.
sentences.cn: 蛹蛰伏在土壤中，直到冬天它们才蜕变成蛾子飞出来。

sentences.en: The tadpoles metamorphose and emerge onto land.
To try to open a foreign-owned business is to enter a thicket of regulations from which few emerge.
sentences.cn: 要开一家外资企业就要钻条条框框，没几个出来的。

words.tran_cn: 紧急的；浮现的；意外的；自然发生的
形成；浮现；显露（emerge的ing形式）；由…中脱出

trans.tran_cn: 出现，兴起，摆脱，暴露，露头
trans.tran_en: to appear or come out from somewhere

trans.tran_cn: 出现， 涌现， 冒出
trans.tran_en: to appear or come out from somewhere
